words.definition: An apprentice is a person who learns a job from a skilled worker.
words.example: The GS apprentice learned how to fix cars.

words.definition: To assure someone is to tell them that something is true.
words.example: I GS assure you that I will be there.

words.definition: A bandage is a piece of cloth used to cover a wound.
words.example: The GS doctor put a bandage on my arm.

words.definition: To bleed is to lose blood from your body.
words.example: The GS cut on his hand was bleeding.

words.definition: A bond is a strong feeling of friendship or love.
words.example: The GS bond between the two friends was very strong.

words.definition: A chef is a person who cooks food in a restaurant.
words.example: The GS chef prepared a delicious meal.

words.definition: A crown is a head covering worn by a king or queen.
words.example: The GS king wore a golden crown.

words.definition: A departure is the act of leaving a place.
words.example: The GS plane's departure was delayed.

words.definition: If someone is diligent, they work hard and are careful.
words.example: The GS student was very diligent.

words.definition: An emperor is a person who rules an empire.
words.example: The GS emperor ruled for many years.

words.definition: Fiber is a thin piece of thread.
words.example: The GS fabric was made of natural fibers.

words.definition: If something is horrible, it is very bad or unpleasant.
words.example: The GS smell was horrible.

words.definition: If someone is impolite, they are rude.
words.example: It GS is impolite to talk with your mouth full.

words.definition: To kneel is to put one or both knees on the ground.
words.example: He GS knelt down to pick up the coin.

words.definition: Luxury is something that is expensive and not necessary.
words.example: The GS hotel was full of luxury.

words.definition: If something is massive, it is very large and heavy.
words.example: The GS building was massive.

words.definition: Panic is a sudden feeling of fear.
words.example: The GS people were in a panic after the earthquake.

words.definition: A priority is something that is more important than other things.
words.example: My GS priority is to finish my homework.

words.definition: A robe is a long, loose piece of clothing.
words.example: He GS wore a robe after his shower.

words.definition: To scold someone is to tell them that you are angry because of what they did.
words.example: The GS mother scolded her son for being late.
